summary: This is an email chain from August 26, 2019, regarding the booking of a room (863) at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS). The emails confirm that the room is needed for the following day to accommodate a large group of Epstein victims, indicating ongoing case-related activities shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.role: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel requesting room booking
persons.context: A person at the U.S. Attorney's Office who asks for room 863 to be booked for the entire day to accommodate a large group of Epstein victims.

connections.description: Both are personnel at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, coordinating the use of room 863 for case-related purposes.

events.title: Room 863 booked for Epstein victims
events.description: Room 863 at the U.S. Attorney's Office is booked for the entire day to accommodate a large group of Epstein victims for meetings or proceedings.

locations: Room 863, U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
keyFacts: The email chain is dated August 26, 2019, the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, showing continued activity in the case.
Room 863 at the USANYS office was needed for a large group of Epstein victims on August 27, 2019.
All rooms booked under the names of the three correspondents for that day were confirmed to be for the Epstein matter.
The correspondence indicates coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding victim accommodations during ongoing legal proceedings.
